revisionDesc.change: moved remaining notes to external file and added ptrs; checked
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Proofreading corrections and Clapp note revision.
Fixed editor, date, and title; reviewed paragraphing
Replaced smart quotes with straight; removed external URL links.
Changed straight quotes to chararacter reference smart quotes.
Added missed opening line "all alone" during Ransom proofreading.
Corrected based on proofreading, expanded Clapp annotation, annotated letter date, speculated on possible meaning of "lessee farlands."

body.p: i receives your kind letter this morning i was glad to hear from you glad you had a good visit i was fearful you dident didn't have quite as good a time as i wanted you to have we cant can't be quite as free to talk when any one is present as if we were alone) but if the visit done peter good it dident didn't doo do us any particular harm) well walt as you say sometimes in your letters things goes on about the same with me as usual only i have been rather lamer than usual

i beleeve believe i am worse when i stay in all the time than when i go out i beleive believe i shall try to go out to morrow tomorrow if its it's pleasant i feel the need of going out a little i thought i would not be away if mr Oconor should call but he has not so i think he has returned to washington Washington)
walter dear you needent needn't send me harpers as i procured it the other night

hellen price was here and spent the day or it was rather late when she came nearly noon but she staid stayed till nearly evening last saturday Saturday Emily is married about two or three weeks ago they board with mrs price but are going to houskeeping mrs price has not been well but has got better except a coughf cough ellen had a letter from Clapp wishing to know if you was in washington Washington as there was nobody out of his own family that he thought so much
of as you that he had written to you but had got no answer he has been to new york and put up at lessey farlands i believe thats that's name and she gave him cloths clothes to make him desentdecent and there has been a collection to get him paper and materials to write hellen said he was tipseytipsy nearly all the time he was in new york New York he wrote to hellen she had the letter here he was never so glad to get back out of new york New York that all was changed) george will be home next saturday Saturday i expect Jeff and all are about the same
